abstract: Warren E. Buffett, the chairman of Berkshire Hathaway and one of the world’s wealthiest investors, says the fall in the Japanese market represents a buying opportunity.
snippet: Warren E. Buffett, the chairman of Berkshire Hathaway and one of the world’s wealthiest investors, says the fall in the Japanese market represents a buying opportunity.
lead_paragraph: Major Japanese stock indexes plunged last week in days of frantic trading, with the Nikkei 225 stock average ending the week down more than 10 percent. But at least one prominent investor says the market has gotten it wrong.

headline.main: Buffett Sees ‘Buying Opportunity’ in Stricken Japan
